snippet: A group financed in part by the Koch brothers is spending millions on ads aimed at vulnerable Democrats who supported the Affordable Care Act.
abstract: Americans for Prosperity, group financed in part by billionaire Koch brothers, is spending millions on television ads aimed at vulnerable Senate and House Democrats who supported the Affordable Care Act; unusually aggressive early run of ads are making Democrats, many of whom lack resources to fight back in early stages of their midterm campaigns, increasingly anxious.

byline.contributor: Nicholas Confessore contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: A group financed in part by the Koch brothers is spending millions on ads aimed at vulnerable Democrats who supported the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: Ads Attacking Health Law Stagger Outspent Democrats
headline.print_headline: Ads Attacking on Health Law Stagger Outspent Democrats

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
